866c7bd90713b29e5f041701949db0af36263a4b.title: Enhancing Face Perception Research with the Chinese Face and Body Dataset (CFBD)

analysis.reason: The paper explicitly includes 'facial expressions' as a manually annotated attribute and examines perception of social traits (attractiveness, trustworthiness, distinctiveness) that are tightly linked to affective processing and emotion perception; trustworthiness in particular is a well-established emotion-adjacent social judgment with affective valence.
evidence: Each image was manually annotated for eight objective attributes: facial expressions, face views, body views, postures, photo types, environments, image quality, and accessories.
Participants rated cropped face images from the CFBD for two social traits (attractiveness, trustworthiness) and one identity-relevant trait (distinctiveness).

These findings suggest that perceived attractiveness and distinctiveness are more dependent on cues that vary across images, whereas trustworthiness is relatively dependent on cues that remain consistent.
research_directions: Role of context and image variability in emotional trait attribution
Computational modeling of affective social traits from facial images

2d7ca1fa45fbb8b8e28edd146b0417feaaa6f975.title: Sense of Self-Agency and Other-Agency Under Social Interaction Contexts

analysis.reason: The paper investigates sense of agency — particularly self-agency and other-agency — in social contexts, which is deeply intertwined with affective and emotional processing (e.g., attribution of intent, mentalizing, social emotion regulation). Though 'emotion' is not explicitly named in the abstract or concepts, agency perception is a core construct in affective science, especially in embodied cognition and social emotion research.
evidence: Sense of agency refers to the subjective perception of initiating and controlling one's actions and their consequences within both individual and social contexts
Other-agency involves comprehension of others' control through mentalizing — a process tightly linked to empathy and emotional inference
The study contrasts human-human vs. human-robot interactions, probing socially embedded affective-cognitive mechanisms
research_directions: Emotion and social cognition in HRI
